meanings.definition: readdict (verb): to become addicted to reading again
meanings.sent1: After rediscovering her favorite book series, she readdicted herself to reading every night.
meanings.sent2: She readdicts easily to new novels, often finishing them in one sitting.
meanings.sent3: The readdict couldn't resist the allure of the library book sale, ending up with a mountain of new reads.
meanings.sent4: Her love for stories readdicted her like a spell, pulling her into different worlds with each turn of the page.
meanings.sent5: The cozy reading nook became her readdictive sanctuary, where she lost track of time immersed in tales.

meanings.definition: readdict (noun): a person who is addicted to reading
meanings.sent1: The readdict always had a book in hand, eager to dive into a new adventure.
meanings.sent2: As a readdict, she spent hours in bookstores, searching for hidden literary gems.
meanings.sent3: The readdict's overflowing bookshelves were a testament to her insatiable love for reading.
meanings.sent4: In a world of screens, she stood out as a readdict, finding solace in the pages of a good book.
meanings.sent5: The readdict's passion for reading burned bright, lighting up her room with the glow of a bedside lamp.
